info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 12 at 3:52PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of west central Broadwater and northeastern Jefferson Counties through 430 PM MDT... At 351 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 9 miles east of Montana City to 10 miles west of Townsend. Movement was west at 20 mph. HAZARD...Torrential rain and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Localized flooding and minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Boulder, Montana City, Wickes, Winston, Alhambra, Corbin, Clancy, Jefferson City and Elkhorn State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
